Package net.paulhertz.aifile

Class BezPoly

java.lang.Object
net.paulhertz.aifile.DisplayComponent
net.paulhertz.aifile.BezShape
net.paulhertz.aifile.BezPoly
All Implemented Interfaces:
ColorableINF, Visitable
public class BezPoly
extends BezShape
Provides factory methods to construct a closed polygonal path consisting of straight line segments. See code example Polygons

  • Nested Class Summary

  • Constructor Details

    • BezPoly

      protected BezPoly​(processing.core.PApplet parent, float[] coords)
      Constructs a closed polygonal shape from an array of float. Fill, stroke, and weight are set from their values in the Processing environment. The shape will be closed and consist only of straight lines. The last coordinate pair and the first should be identical for a properly closed polygon (it will be marked as closed when exported to Adobe Illustrator, regardless).
      Parameters:
      parent - a PApplet
      coords - an array of coordinate pairs

    • BezPoly

      protected BezPoly​(processing.core.PApplet parent, java.util.ArrayList<LineVertex> points)
      Constructs a closed polygonal shape from a list of LineVertex. Fill, stroke, and weight are set from their values in the Processing environment. The shape will be closed and consist only of straight lines. The last coordinate pair and the first should be identical for a properly closed polygon (it will be marked as closed when exported to Adobe Illustrator, regardless).
      Parameters:
      parent - a PApplet
      points - an ArrayList of LineVertex

  • Method Details

    • makePoly

      public static BezPoly makePoly​(processing.core.PApplet parent, float[] coords)
      Constructs a closed polygonal shape from an array of float. Fill, stroke, and weight are set from their values in the Processing environment. The shape will be closed and consist only of straight lines. The last coordinate pair and the first should be the same for a properly closed polygon (it will be marked as closed when exported to Adobe Illustrator, regardless).
      Parameters:
      parent - a PApplet
      coords - an array of coordinate pairs
      Returns:
      a closed polygon of type BezShape.BEZ_POLY

    • makePoly

      public static BezPoly makePoly​(float[] coords)
      Constructs a closed polygonal shape from an array of float. Fill, stroke, and weight are set from their values in the Processing environment. The shape will be closed and consist only of straight lines. The last coordinate pair and the first should be the same for a properly closed polygon (it will be marked as closed when exported to Adobe Illustrator, regardless). PApplet used for calls to the Processing environment is obtained from IgnoCodeLib, which must be correctly initialized in setup. If IgnoCodeLib does not have a reference to a PApplet, it throws a NullPointerException.
      Parameters:
      coords - an array of coordinate pairs
      Returns:
      a closed polygon of type BezShape.BEZ_POLY

    • makePolyVertex2D

      public static BezPoly makePolyVertex2D​(processing.core.PApplet parent, java.util.ArrayList<Vertex2DINF> points)
      Constructs a closed polygonal shape from a list of Vertex2DINF. Only the anchor points of a BezVertex will be used, control points are ignored. Fill, stroke, and weight are set from their values in the Processing environment. The shape will be closed and consist only of straight lines. The last vertex and the first should be the same for a properly closed polygon (it will be marked as closed when exported to Adobe Illustrator, regardless).
      Parameters:
      parent - a PApplet
      points - an ArrayList of Vertex2DINF.
      Returns:
      a closed polygon of type BezShape.BEZ_POLY

    • makePolyVertex2D

      public static BezPoly makePolyVertex2D​(java.util.ArrayList<Vertex2DINF> points)
      Constructs a closed polygonal shape from a list of Vertex2DINF. Only the anchor points of a BezVertex will be used, control points are ignored. Fill, stroke, and weight are set from their values in the Processing environment. The shape will be closed and consist only of straight lines. The last vertex and the first should be the same for a properly closed polygon (it will be marked as closed when exported to Adobe Illustrator, regardless). PApplet used for calls to the Processing environment is obtained from IgnoCodeLib, which must be correctly initialized in setup. If IgnoCodeLib does not have a reference to a PApplet, it throws a NullPointerException.
      Parameters:
      points - an ArrayList of Vertex2DINF.
      Returns:
      a closed polygon of type BezShape.BEZ_POLY

    • makePolyLineVertex

      public static BezPoly makePolyLineVertex​(processing.core.PApplet parent, java.util.ArrayList<LineVertex> points)
      Constructs a closed polygonal shape from a list of LineVertex. Fill, stroke, and weight are set from their values in the Processing environment. The shape will be closed and consist only of straight lines. The last vertex and the first should be the same for a properly closed polygon (it will be marked as closed when exported to Adobe Illustrator, regardless).
      Parameters:
      parent - a PApplet
      points - an ArrayList of LineVertex.
      Returns:
      a closed polygon of type BezShape.BEZ_POLY

    • makePolyLineVertex

      public static BezPoly makePolyLineVertex​(java.util.ArrayList<LineVertex> points)
      Constructs a closed polygonal shape from a list of LineVertex. Fill, stroke, and weight are set from their values in the Processing environment. The shape will be closed and consist only of straight lines. The last vertex and the first should be the same for a properly closed polygon (it will be marked as closed when exported to Adobe Illustrator, regardless). PApplet used for calls to the Processing environment is obtained from IgnoCodeLib, which must be correctly initialized in setup. If IgnoCodeLib does not have a reference to a PApplet, it throws a NullPointerException.
      Parameters:
      points - an ArrayList of LineVertex.
      Returns:
      a closed polygon of type BezShape.BEZ_POLY

    • getStarCoords

      public static float[] getStarCoords​(float x0, float y0, float innerRadius, float outerRadius, int nArms)
      Returns geometry of a star as an array of float.
      Parameters:
      x0 - X center of star.
      y0 - Y center of star.
      innerRadius - Inner radis of arms.
      outerRadius - Outer radius of arms.
      nArms - Number of arms.
      Returns:
      Geometry of star [x,y,x,y,...].
